history.feedback: No, I haven't seen Dr. Hawthorne since the conference last week.

history.feedback: I was reviewing some of Dr. Reed's old research papers in the library, trying to understand his perspective better for our upcoming meeting.

history.question: What were you doing at the abandoned warehouse last night?
history.feedback: I was setting up my equipment for a freelance project meeting.

history.question: Have you ever had any conflicts with Jonathan Edwards?
history.feedback: Not that I can recall; our paths rarely crossed, and we never had any reason to conflict.

history.question: Did you have any disagreements with Jonathan Edwards recently?
history.feedback: No, we always got along great; I can't believe this is happening!

history.question: Were you in any disputes with Jonathan Edwards before his death?
history.feedback: No, our interactions were professional, and there were no disputes between us.

history.question: Did you have any personal reasons to harm Jonathan Edwards?
history.feedback: Jonathan and I had a professional disagreement, but that's all.

history.question: Do you have any alibi for 8pm last night?
history.feedback: I was reviewing my footage from the warehouse at home, trying to piece together the information I gathered that afternoon.

history.question: Were you in contact with Jonathan Edwards on the day of his death?
history.feedback: I received a call about a business opportunity, but I didn't know who it was from.

history.question: Did you clean up alone at the abandoned warehouse last night, or did anyone accompany you?
history.feedback: I came alone, but I saw some lights flickering when I arrived, so I assumed someone else was there too.

history.question: Did you notice anyone unusual or suspicious at the abandoned warehouse around the time of Jonathan Edwards' murder?
history.feedback: I noticed Alex Turner and Sophia Reynolds entering the warehouse, but they seemed to be there for their own reasons and didn't appear suspicious to me.

history.question: What were you doing with the antique marble bust between 7pm and 9pm last night?
history.feedback: I was assisting Dr. Eleanor Blackwood in setting up her presentation materials and later checking on the security of the library's collections, including the antique marble bust, around 8:20 PM.

history.question: Did you have any disputes or disagreements with Dr. Eleanor Blackwood prior to her death?
history.feedback: No, not really; our disagreements were more about the interpretation of data than personal animosity.

history.question: Did you have any conflicts with Dr. Eleanor Blackwood regarding her recent book?
history.feedback: Yes, she challenged my theories quite aggressively, which was particularly frustrating given the years of research behind them.

history.question: Were you the one who discussed the potential donation of rare historical texts with Mr. Jonathan Reed?
history.feedback: No, I was out of town that week, but I heard it might have been him. Why do you ask?

history.question: Did you have any reason to be upset with Dr. Eleanor Blackwood before her death?
history.feedback: Oh, no, never! Actually, I was quite fascinated by her work and wanted to understand her perspective better. It's just that her theories were so bold, I felt they needed more evidence.

history.question: Did you notice anything suspicious around the antique marble bust after checking it at 8:20 PM?
history.feedback: No, everything seemed secure and in place after I checked the bust.

history.feedback: I don't recall seeing Ms. Thompson; I was mostly focused on calming down after my argument with Dr. Blackwood.

history.feedback: No, I didn't notice anything like that, just some old books and dust.

history.feedback: Between 7pm and 9pm, I was attending the staff meeting to discuss the upcoming exhibit.

history.feedback: I was just walking home from a late shift at the factory down the road.

history.question: Did you know Jonathan Harper?
history.feedback: Yes, I worked closely with Jonathan on several projects, and he became like a mentor to me.

history.feedback: I was there to conduct a final inspection of the warehouse's structural integrity before providing an estimate to a potential client.

history.feedback: Not really; we had a falling out years ago, but we've managed to keep in touch professionally.

history.question: Do you have any alibi for being at the abandoned warehouse at midnight?
history.feedback: I was just checking on something, you know, making sure everything was okay. It's not like I was planning anything bad, just worried about Jonathan.
